content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same problem, even if the question is phrased differently, the conclusion should remain consistent.)

The shortest path from node 4 to node 6 is:


```arduino
4 -> 6
```
Note that the graph provided only includes edges between nodes, not the lengths of the edges. Therefore, the shortest path is simply the sequence of nodes traversed from the starting point to the destination point. In this case, node 4 is the starting point and node 6 is the destination, so the shortest path is simply "4 -> 6".

The shortest path from node 4 to node 6 is:


```
4 -> 6
```
This is the shortest path that connects node 4 to node 6 in the graph. It follows the sequence of nodes from node 4 to node 6, skipping any intermediate nodes that are not part of the path.
